alert.note: Alert for Kane; Washington (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 19 at 1:48PM MDT until August 19 at 4:45PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR WEST CENTRAL KANE AND EAST CENTRAL WASHINGTON COUNTIES... At 148 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicates that up to an inch and half of rain has fallen on the western drainages near the headwaters of the Narrows region, with around a half inch to an inch from Mystery Canyon northward. The thunderstorms which originally prompted the warning have since weakened, but others are continuing to build and move into the warned area. With water still running out from past storms and more storms building, the threat continues. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Zion National Park and Springdale. This includes the following streams and drainages... Oak Creek, Crystal Creek, Virgin River, Clear Creek, Right Fork North Creek, North Creek, Kolob Creek, Little Creek, Blue Creek, North Fork Virgin River, East Fork Virgin River and Deep Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
